content:
Hi all,

Does anyone know how to solve this type of issue: "None of the codes provided are in the value set http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/identifier-type (http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/identifier-type, and a code should come from this value set unless it has no suitable code) (codes = http://hl7.org/fhir/v2/0203#HC)".

i'm using jpa server 3.4.0 from HAPI FHIR to validate messages , and also i've created my own ValueSet resource, that i've persisted on server as method to solve problem, but this error still exist.

Thanks.

First, that should be a warning as the software can't know if the code for your concept falls outside the space of the original value set. Second, does your new value set include codes from the original value set where you're covering the same conceptual space?
Lloyd, thanks for your help. At the moment i only have code 'HC' in my new ValueSet. Please check the attachment. HC_ValueSet
And is it a warning, not an error?
Yes, its a warning and i want to solve problem that make this warning appear.
You can't. The warning is saying that a human needs to review and make sure the HC code is legitimate. You can choose to ignore it, but you can't make it go away
And how it is possible to ignore this warning? i mean, to make this warning disappear.
Write code that wraps the validator that suppresses messages you know aren't relevant.
